title: Nationalities
sentences: I am from Spain and I live in Madrid.
My friend Juan is Spanish and speaks very fast.
Are you from Mexico or Colombia?
She is a Mexican tourist visiting the city.
I speak a little English but I want to learn more.
My cousins have lived in the United States for years.
He is American and works in an office.
Do you know how to speak French? It's a very beautiful language.
Paris is the capital of France.
I really like Italian food, especially pasta.
Rome is a very ancient Italian city.
What part of Germany are you from?
My teacher is German and is very serious.
He is a very famous Brazilian player.
I am learning the Chinese language because it is very useful.
Tokyo is a very modern Japanese city.
That camera is Japanese and takes incredible photos.
Moscow is the capital of Russia.
I have a Russian friend who lives on my street.
London is a city in England.
She is Portuguese but lives in Madrid.
Lisbon is a very beautiful city in Portugal.
How do you say this word in German?
Buenos Aires es la capital de
Buenos Aires is the capital of Argentina.
My grandmother is Argentine and cooks very well.
Is it difficult to learn Russian?
In Canada, English and French are spoken.
He is a very well-known Canadian actor.
Are you from Australia or New Zealand?
My best friend is Australian and likes surfing.
Athens is the capital of Greece.
Warsaw is the capital of Poland.
El Cairo es la capital de
Cairo is the capital of Egypt.
I study Egyptian culture at school.
Do you know anyone Chinese in this city?
dictionary:
España - Spain
Español/a - Spanish
México - Mexico
Mexicano/a - Mexican
Inglés/a - English
Estados Unidos - United States
Estadounidense - American (USA)
Francia - France
Francés/a - French
Italia - Italy
Italiano/a - Italian
Alemania - Germany
Alemán/a - German
Brasil - Brazil
Brasileño/a - Brazilian
China - China
Chino/a - Chinese
Japón - Japan
Japonés/a - Japanese
Rusia - Russia
Ruso/a - Russian
Inglaterra - England
Portugal - Portugal
Portugués/a - Portuguese
Argentina - Argentina
Argentino/a - Argentine
Canadá - Canada
Canadiense - Canadian
Australia - Australia
Australiano/a - Australian
Grecia - Greece
Griego/a - Greek
Polonia - Poland
Polaco/a - Polish
Egipto - Egypt
Egipcio/a - Egyptian
